DE000EB0DFE40131337368A86D17958E.description: recognize that works of visual art are produced by artisans and artists working in different cultures, times and places.

DDFFC0B0DFE40131337268A86D17958E.description: demonstrate understanding of how the visual arts are used in the world around us; and

DDFF7780DFE40131337168A86D17958E.description: describe how the visual arts are combined with other arts in multimedia work;

DDFF2150DFE40131337068A86D17958E.description: identify connections between the visual arts and other disciplines in the curriculum;

DDFECAD0DFE40131336F68A86D17958E.description: identify connections between characteristics of the visual arts and other arts disciplines;

DDFE6CA0DFE40131336E68A86D17958E.description: Students will make connections between the visual arts, other disciplines and daily life.

DDFB9740DFE40131336568A86D17958E.description: identify possible improvements in the process of creating their own work.

DDFB4300DFE40131336468A86D17958E.description: describe their personal responses to specific works of art using visual art terminology; and

DDFAF820DFE40131336368A86D17958E.description: recognize that there are different responses to specific works of art;

DDFAAC80DFE40131336268A86D17958E.description: describe visual characteristics of works of art using visual art terminology;

DDFA5DF0DFE40131336168A86D17958E.description: identify various purposes for creating works of art;

DDFA0520DFE40131336068A86D17958E.description: Students will reflect upon, describe, analyze, interpret and evaluate their own and others' work.

DDF23AC0DFE40131334868A86D17958E.description: create art work that demonstrates understanding of how history or culture can influence visual art.

DDF1E4B0DFE40131334768A86D17958E.description: identify specific works of art as belonging to particular styles, cultures, times and places; and

DDF16D00DFE40131334668A86D17958E.description: recognize that the visual arts have a history and a variety of cultural purposes and meanings;

DDF11480DFE40131334568A86D17958E.description: Students will understand the visual arts in relation to history and cultures.

DDEEE260DFE40131333E68A86D17958E.description: select and use subject matter, symbols and ideas to communicate meaning.

DDEE9C00DFE40131333D68A86D17958E.description: discuss a variety of sources for art content; and

DDEE55B0DFE40131333C68A86D17958E.description: Students will consider, select and apply a range of subject matter, symbols and ideas.

DDE93410DFE40131332B68A86D17958E.description: use the elements of art and principles of design to communicate ideas.

DDE8ECE0DFE40131332A68A86D17958E.description: describe how different expressive features, and ways of organizing them, cause different responses; and

DDE8A340DFE40131332968A86D17958E.description: identify the different ways visual characteristics are used to convey ideas;

DDE85280DFE40131332868A86D17958E.description: Students will understand and apply elements and organizational principles of art.

DDD86200DFE40131330968A86D17958E.description: use art media and tools in a safe and responsible manner.

DDD80A20DFE40131330868A86D17958E.description: use different media, techniques and processes to communicate ideas, feelings, experiences and stories; and

DDD79C30DFE40131330768A86D17958E.description: describe how different media, techniques and processes cause different effects and personal responses;

DDD742A0DFE40131330668A86D17958E.description: differentiate between a variety of media, techniques and processes;

DDD6F940DFE40131330568A86D17958E.description: Students will understand, select and apply media, techniques and processes.

DE0AD330DFE40131339268A86D17958E.description: identify and compare the various cultural settings and reasons for creating dramas and attending theatre.

DE0A8330DFE40131339168A86D17958E.description: identify and compare similar characters and situations in stories and dramas from and about various cultures, create classroom dramatizations based on these stories and dramas, and discuss how theatre reflects life; and

DE0A37D0DFE40131339068A86D17958E.description: Students will demonstrate an understanding of context by analyzing and comparing theatre in various cultures and historical periods.

DE099090DFE40131338E68A86D17958E.description: analyze classroom dramatizations and, using appropriate terminology, constructively suggest (1) alternative ideas for dramatizing roles, arranging environments and developing situations and (2) means of improving the collaborative processes of planning, playing, responding and evaluating.

DE094000DFE40131338D68A86D17958E.description: articulate emotional responses to and explain personal preferences about whole dramatic performances as well as parts of those performances; and

DE08D640DFE40131338C68A86D17958E.description: explain how the wants and needs of characters are similar to and different from their own;

DE0868B0DFE40131338B68A86D17958E.description: identify and describe the visual, aural, oral and kinetic elements of classroom dramatizations and dramatic performances;

DE080ED0DFE40131338A68A86D17958E.description: Students will analyze, critique and construct meanings from works of theatre.

DE0499B0DFE40131337F68A86D17958E.description: identify various careers available to theatre artists.

DE044420DFE40131337E68A86D17958E.description: identify connections between theatre and other disciplines in the curriculum; and

DE03EF90DFE40131337D68A86D17958E.description: select movement, music or visual elements to enhance the mood of a classroom dramatization;

DE039860DFE40131337C68A86D17958E.description: compare how ideas and emotions are expressed in theatre, dance, music and visual arts;

DE032AD0DFE40131337B68A86D17958E.description: describe visual, aural, oral and kinetic elements in theatre, dance, music and visual arts;

DE02AD80DFE40131337A68A86D17958E.description: Students will make connections between theatre, other disciplines and daily life.

DDF94F90DFE40131335E68A86D17958E.description: communicate information to peers about people, events, time and place related to classroom dramatizations.

DDF8F990DFE40131335D68A86D17958E.description: Students will research, evaluate and apply cultural and historical information to make artistic choices.

DDF4B0B0DFE40131335068A86D17958E.description: collaboratively plan and prepare improvisations and demonstrate various ways of staging classroom dramatizations.

DDF45ED0DFE40131334F68A86D17958E.description: Students will direct by planning or interpreting works of theatre and by organizing and conducting rehearsals.

DDEDC590DFE40131333A68A86D17958E.description: collaborate to select and safely organize available materials that suggest scenery, properties, lighting, sound, costumes and makeup.

DDED6EC0DFE40131333968A86D17958E.description: design the playing space to communicate characters and action in specific locales; and

DDED24A0DFE40131333868A86D17958E.description: Students will design and produce the technical elements of theatre through artistic interpretation and execution.

DDDC2740DFE40131331568A86D17958E.description: assume roles (based on personal experience and heritage, imagination, literature and history) in classroom dramatizations.

DDDBDA50DFE40131331468A86D17958E.description: use variations of locomotor and nonlocomotor movement and vocal pitch, tempo and tone for different characters; and

DDDB8BB0DFE40131331368A86D17958E.description: imagine and clearly describe characters, their relationships and their environments;

DDDB1D10DFE40131331268A86D17958E.description: Students will act by developing, communicating and sustaining characters.

DDD66590DFE40131330368A86D17958E.description: improvise dialogue to tell stories, and formalize improvisations by writing or recording the dialogue.

DDD61A10DFE40131330268A86D17958E.description: collaborate to select interrelated characters, environments and situations for classroom dramatizations; and

DDD5C970DFE40131330168A86D17958E.description: Students will create theatre through improvising, writing and refining scripts.

DE0EB5B0DFE40131339D68A86D17958E.description: demonstrate audience behavior appropriate for the context and style of music performed.

DE0E5340DFE40131339C68A86D17958E.description: identify and describe roles of musicians in various music settings and cultures; and

DE0DFA60DFE40131339B68A86D17958E.description: identify various uses of music in their daily experiences and describe characteristics that make certain music suitable for each use;

DE0D93E0DFE40131339A68A86D17958E.description: describe in simple terms how elements of music are used in music examples from various cultures of the world;

DE0D3380DFE40131339968A86D17958E.description: identify by genre or style aural examples of music from various historical periods and cultures;

DE0CE0B0DFE40131339868A86D17958E.description: Students will understand music in relation to history and culture.

DE0C4300DFE40131339668A86D17958E.description: identify ways in which the principles and subject matter of music and other disciplines taught in the school are interrelated.

DE0BF180DFE40131339568A86D17958E.description: identify similarities and differences in the meanings of common terms used in the various arts; and

DE0B8480DFE40131339468A86D17958E.description: Students will make connections between music, other disciplines and daily life.

DE0774E0DFE40131338868A86D17958E.description: explain, using appropriate music terminology, their personal preferences for specific musical works and styles.

DE072ED0DFE40131338768A86D17958E.description: devise criteria for evaluating performances and compositions; and

DE06E6F0DFE40131338668A86D17958E.description: Students will evaluate music and music performances.

DDFDC890DFE40131336C68A86D17958E.description: respond through purposeful movement to selected prominent music characteristics or to specific music events while listening to music.

DDFD7A70DFE40131336B68A86D17958E.description: identify the sounds of a variety of instruments, including many orchestra and band instruments, and instruments from various cultures, as well as children's voices and male and female adult voices; and

DDFD17F0DFE40131336A68A86D17958E.description: use appropriate terminology in explaining music, music notation, music instruments and voices, and music performances;

DDFCCD40DFE40131336968A86D17958E.description: demonstrate perceptual skills by moving in response to, by answering questions about, and by describing aural examples of music of various styles representing diverse cultures;

DDFC8680DFE40131336868A86D17958E.description: identify simple music forms when presented;

DDFC3E70DFE40131336768A86D17958E.description: Students will listen to, describe and analyze music.

DDF86080DFE40131335B68A86D17958E.description: use standard symbols to notate meter, rhythm, pitch and dynamics in simple patterns presented by the teacher.

DDF80F20DFE40131335A68A86D17958E.description: identify symbols and traditional terms referring to dynamics, tempo and articulation and interpret them correctly when performing; and

DDF7C0D0DFE40131335968A86D17958E.description: use a system (that is, syllables, numbers or letters) to read simple pitch notation in the treble clef in major keys;

DDF75750DFE40131335868A86D17958E.description: read whole, half, dotted half, quarter and eighth notes and rests in 2/4, 3/4, and 4/4 meter signatures;

DDF6FB10DFE40131335768A86D17958E.description: Students will read and notate music.

DDF3B510DFE40131334D68A86D17958E.description: use a variety of sound sources when composing.

DDF36E00DFE40131334C68A86D17958E.description: create and arrange short songs and instrumental pieces within specified guidelines; and

DDF31300DFE40131334B68A86D17958E.description: create and arrange music to accompany readings or dramatizations;

DDF2CC40DFE40131334A68A86D17958E.description: Students will compose and arrange music.

DDEAEF70DFE40131333168A86D17958E.description: improvise short songs and instrumental pieces, using a variety of sound sources, including traditional sounds, nontraditional sounds available in the classroom, body sounds, and sounds produced by electronic means.

DDEAA990DFE40131333068A86D17958E.description: improvise simple rhythmic variations and simple melodic embellishments on familiar melodies; and

DDEA6230DFE40131332F68A86D17958E.description: improvise simple rhythmic and melodic ostinato accompaniments;

DDEA1350DFE40131332E68A86D17958E.description: improvise "answers" in the same style to given rhythmic and melodic phrases;

DDE9C1E0DFE40131332D68A86D17958E.description: Students will improvise melodies, variations and accompaniments.

DDE7B960DFE40131332668A86D17958E.description: perform independent instrumental parts while other students sing or play contrasting parts.

DDE76D60DFE40131332568A86D17958E.description: perform in groups, blending instrumental timbres, matching dynamic levels, and responding to the cues of a conductor; and

DDE71EB0DFE40131332468A86D17958E.description: echo short rhythms and melodic patterns;

DDE6AA10DFE40131332368A86D17958E.description: perform expressively a varied repertoire of music representing diverse genres and styles;

DDE06780DFE40131332268A86D17958E.description: perform easy rhythmic, melodic and chordal patterns accurately and independently on rhythmic, melodic and harmonic classroom instruments;

DDE00C50DFE40131332168A86D17958E.description: perform on pitch, in rhythm, with appropriate dynamics and timbre, and maintain a steady tempo;

DDDFB690DFE40131332068A86D17958E.description: Students will play, alone and with others, a varied repertoire of instrumental music.

DDDA7490DFE40131331068A86D17958E.description: sing in groups, blending vocal timbres, matching dynamic levels, and responding to the cues of a conductor.

DDDA29B0DFE40131330F68A86D17958E.description: sing ostinatos, partner songs and rounds; and

DDD9DEB0DFE40131330E68A86D17958E.description: sing from memory a varied repertoire of songs representing genres and styles from diverse cultures;

DDD99180DFE40131330D68A86D17958E.description: sing expressively, with appropriate dynamics, phrasing and interpretation;

DDD93B40DFE40131330C68A86D17958E.description: sing independently, on pitch and in rhythm, with appropriate timbre, diction and posture, and maintain a steady tempo;

DDD8F3D0DFE40131330B68A86D17958E.description: Students will sing, alone and with others, a varied repertoire of songs.

DE064520DFE40131338468A86D17958E.description: video record a simple dance (after collaborative planning in small groups) which successfully shows the concept or idea that drives the dance.

DE05E690DFE40131338368A86D17958E.description: respond to a dance using another art form, and explain the connections between the dance and their response to it (for example, making a painting about a dance and describing the connections); and

DE059AA0DFE40131338268A86D17958E.description: create a dance project that reveals understanding of a concept or idea from another discipline (such as pattern in dance and science);

DE054A30DFE40131338168A86D17958E.description: Students will make connections between dance, other disciplines and daily life.

DE0204D0DFE40131337868A86D17958E.description: explain how healthful practices (such as nutrition, safety) enhance their ability to dance, citing multiple examples.

DE01BB20DFE40131337768A86D17958E.description: describe the skeleton and how it works in simple terms; and

DE016CC0DFE40131337668A86D17958E.description: identify at least three personal goals to improve themselves as dancers;

DE0103B0DFE40131337568A86D17958E.description: Students will make connections between dance and healthful living.

DDF650D0DFE40131335568A86D17958E.description: answer questions about dance in a particular culture and time period (for example: In colonial America, why and in what settings did people dance? What did the dances look like?).

DDF607B0DFE40131335468A86D17958E.description: perform a dance from a resource in their own community, and describe the cultural and/or historical context (how and why this dance is/was performed); and

DDF5B8C0DFE40131335368A86D17958E.description: perform folk dances from various cultures with competence and confidence;

DDF56AD0DFE40131335268A86D17958E.description: Students will demonstrate an understanding of dance in various cultures and historical periods.

DDF08590DFE40131334368A86D17958E.description: demonstrate appropriate audience behavior in watching dance performances, and discuss their opinions about the dances with their peers in a supportive and constructive way.

DDF03B30DFE40131334268A86D17958E.description: observe two dances and discuss how they are similar and different in terms of one of the elements of dance (such as space) by observing body shapes, levels, pathways; and

DDEFED20DFE40131334168A86D17958E.description: explore, discover and realize multiple solutions to a given movement problem, choose their favorite solution and discuss the reasons for their choice;

DDEF9920DFE40131334068A86D17958E.description: Students will apply analytical and evaluative thinking skills in dance.

DDEC8F10DFE40131333668A86D17958E.description: present their own dances to peers and discuss their meanings with confidence.

DDEC37D0DFE40131333568A86D17958E.description: take an active role ina class discussion about interpretations of and reactions to dances that are either produced in class or viewed in the theatre or on video; and

DDEBCF00DFE40131333468A86D17958E.description: observe and discuss how dance is different from other forms of human movement (such as sports, everyday gestures);

DDEB7A80DFE40131333368A86D17958E.description: Students will understand how dance creates and communicates meaning.

DDDF1790DFE40131331E68A86D17958E.description: identify and describe the choreographic structure of their own dances in simple terms.

DDDEC4F0DFE40131331D68A86D17958E.description: improvise, create and perform simple dances based on concepts suggested by the teacher and their own feelings and ideas; and

DDDE7920DFE40131331C68A86D17958E.description: demonstrate the following partner skills: copying, leading and following, mirroring;

DDDE2D70DFE40131331B68A86D17958E.description: demonstrate the ability to work effectively alone and with a partner;

DDDDDEE0DFE40131331A68A86D17958E.description: create a dance phrase, repeat it, and then vary it (making changes in the time, space, and/or force/energy);

DDDD86C0DFE40131331968A86D17958E.description: create a sequence or simple dance with a beginning, middle and end, both with and without a rhythmic accompaniment, and identify each of these sequence parts;

DDDD15F0DFE40131331868A86D17958E.description: use improvisation to discover and invent movement and to solve movement problems;

DDDCBD20DFE40131331768A86D17958E.description: Students will understand choreographic principles, processes and structures.

DDD52700DFE4013132FF68A86D17958E.description: observe and describe the movement elements (action, space, dynamics) in a brief movement study.

DDD4E0E0DFE4013132FE68A86D17958E.description: demonstrate accuracy in memorizing and reproducing simple movement phrases; and

DDD49A10DFE4013132FD68A86D17958E.description: demonstrate kinesthetic awareness and concentration in performing movement skills;

DDD45240DFE4013132FC68A86D17958E.description: identify and demonstrate basic dynamic contrasts (slow/quick, gentle/strong);

DDD402D0DFE4013132FB68A86D17958E.description: demonstrate accuracy in moving to a musical beat and responding to changes in tempo;

DDD3A3B0DFE4013132FA68A86D17958E.description:
demonstrate understanding of spatial concepts through, for example:
  • shape-making at low, middle and high levels;
  • defining and maintaining personal space; and
  • demonstrating movements in straight and curved pathways;

DDD34FD0DFE4013132F968A86D17958E.description: demonstrate eight basic locomotor movements (walk, run, hop, jump, leap, gallop, slide and skip), traveling forward, backward, sideward, diagonally and turning;

DDD2F960DFE4013132F868A86D17958E.description: demonstrate nonlocomotor movements (such as bend, twist, stretch, swing, sway);

DDD292F0DFE4013132F768A86D17958E.description: Students will identify and perform movement elements and dance skills.
